abstract.p: Art exhibition, film and discussion series at Puffin Cultural Forum in Teaneck, NJ, will focus on New Jersey Meadowlands, which has become environmental battleground (S)

block.p: The Meadowlands is one of the most reviled and ecologically damaged pieces of land in the United States, while it is some of the most valuable and environmentally fragile land in the country. Because of that contradiction, the Meadowlands has become an environmental battleground.
That battle is depicted in an art exhibition and film and discussion series being held at the Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue, Teaneck, through June 24.

That battle is depicted in an art exhibition and film and discussion series being held at the Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue, Teaneck, through June 24.
''Terra Infirma: Art, Activism and the Environment'' includes 20 photographs by Greenpeace International photographers of environmental disasters.
Also on display are prints by Richard K. Mills of Teaneck, a member of the Hackensack River Greenway Project.

The Andy Middleton Quintet will perform ''Jazz Inspired by the State of Our Earth'' today. Lavender Lake, a documentary on the cleanup efforts for the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn will be shown on Friday.
